classes.name: HttpServletRequest
classes.description: Extends the ServletRequest interface to provide request information for HTTP servlets. The servlet container creates an HttpServletRequest object and passes it as an argument to the servlet's service methods (doGet, doPost, etc.).

methods.name: getMethod

returns.description: The name of the HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)

methods.description: Returns the name of the HTTP method with which this request was made, for example GET, POST, or PUT.

methods.name: getRequestURI

returns.description: The part of the URL from the protocol name up to the query string

methods.description: Returns the part of this request's URL from the protocol name up to the query string in the first line of the HTTP request.

methods.name: getRequestURL

returns.description: The reconstructed URL

methods.description: Reconstructs the URL the client used to make the request. The returned URL contains a protocol, server name, port number, and server path, but it does not include query string parameters.

methods.name: getQueryString

returns.description: The query string, or null if the URL contains no query string

methods.description: Returns the query string that is contained in the request URL after the path. Returns null if the URL does not have a query string.

methods.name: getPathInfo

returns.description: The extra path information, or null if not specified

methods.description: Returns any extra path information associated with the URL the client sent when it made this request. The extra path information follows the servlet path but precedes the query string.

methods.name: getContextPath

returns.description: The portion of the request URI that indicates the context of the request

methods.description: Returns the portion of the request URI that indicates the context of the request. The context path always comes first in a request URI and starts with a / character.

methods.name: getServletPath

returns.description: The part of the URL that calls the servlet

methods.description: Returns the part of this request's URL that calls the servlet. This path starts with a / character and includes either the servlet name or a path to the servlet.

methods.name: getHeader

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the request header

returns.description: The value of the requested header, or null if not present

methods.description: Returns the value of the specified request header as a String. If the request did not include a header of the specified name, this method returns null.

methods.name: getHeaders

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the request header

returns.description: An Enumeration of String values for the header

methods.description: Returns all the values of the specified request header as an Enumeration of String objects. Some headers, such as Accept-Language, can be sent by clients as several headers with different values.

methods.name: getHeaderNames

returns.description: An Enumeration of all header names sent with this request

methods.description: Returns an enumeration of all the header names this request contains. If the request has no headers, this method returns an empty enumeration.

methods.name: getIntHeader

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the request header

returns.description: The value of the header as an integer, or -1 if not present

methods.description: Returns the value of the specified request header as an int. If the request does not have a header of the specified name, this method returns -1.

methods.name: getParameter

returns.description: The value of the parameter, or null if not present

methods.description: Returns the value of a request parameter as a String, or null if the parameter does not exist. Request parameters are contained in the query string or posted form data.

methods.name: getParameterValues

returns.description: An array of String values, or null if the parameter does not exist

methods.description: Returns an array of String objects containing all of the values the given request parameter has, or null if the parameter does not exist.

methods.name: getParameterNames

returns.description: An Enumeration of String objects containing the parameter names

methods.description: Returns an Enumeration of String objects containing the names of the parameters contained in this request.

methods.name: getParameterMap

returns.description: An immutable Map of parameter names to String array values

methods.description: Returns a java.util.Map of the parameters of this request. Request parameters are contained in the query string or posted form data.

methods.name: getAttribute

returns.description: The value of the attribute, or null if no attribute of the given name exists

methods.description: Returns the value of the named attribute as an Object, or null if no attribute of the given name exists. Attributes can be set by the servlet container or by a servlet.

methods.name: setAttribute

params.name: o
params.description: The Object to be stored, or null to remove the attribute

methods.description: Stores an attribute in this request. Attributes are reset between requests. If the object passed is null, the effect is the same as calling removeAttribute.

methods.name: removeAttribute

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the attribute to remove

methods.description: Removes an attribute from this request. This method is not generally needed as attributes only persist as long as the request is being handled.

methods.name: getAttributeNames

returns.description: An Enumeration of strings containing the names of the request's attributes

methods.description: Returns an Enumeration containing the names of the attributes available to this request.

methods.name: getSession

returns.description: The HttpSession associated with this request

methods.description: Returns the current session associated with this request, or if the request does not have a session, creates one.

methods.name: getSession

params.name: create
params.description: True to create a new session if none exists; false to return null

returns.description: The HttpSession associated with this request, or null if create is false and no session exists

methods.description: Returns the current HttpSession associated with this request or, if there is no current session and create is true, returns a new session.

methods.name: getCookies

returns.description: An array of all the Cookies included with this request, or null if the request has no cookies

methods.description: Returns an array containing all of the Cookie objects the client sent with this request. This method returns null if no cookies were sent.

methods.name: getContentType

returns.description: The MIME type of the body of the request, or null if the type is not known

methods.description: Returns the MIME type of the body of the request, or null if the type is not known.

methods.name: getContentLength

returns.description: The length of the request body in bytes, or -1 if the length is not known

methods.description: Returns the length, in bytes, of the request body and made available by the input stream, or -1 if the length is not known.

methods.name: getCharacterEncoding

returns.description: The name of the character encoding, or null if not specified

methods.description: Returns the name of the character encoding used in the body of this request, or null if the request does not specify a character encoding.

methods.name: getInputStream

returns.description: A ServletInputStream for reading binary data from the request body

methods.description: Retrieves the body of the request as binary data using a ServletInputStream. Either this method or getReader may be called to read the body, not both.

methods.name: getReader

returns.description: A BufferedReader for reading the body of the request as character data

methods.description: Retrieves the body of the request as character data using a BufferedReader. The reader translates the character data according to the character encoding used on the body.

methods.name: getRemoteAddr

returns.description: The IP address of the client or last proxy that sent the request

methods.description: Returns the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the client or last proxy that sent the request.

methods.name: getRemoteHost

returns.description: The fully qualified name of the client

methods.description: Returns the fully qualified name of the client or the last proxy that sent the request. If the engine cannot or chooses not to resolve the hostname, this method returns the IP address.

methods.name: getRemotePort

returns.description: The source port of the client or last proxy that sent the request

methods.description: Returns the Internet Protocol (IP) source port of the client or last proxy that sent the request.

methods.name: getLocalAddr

returns.description: The IP address on which the request was received

methods.description: Returns the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the interface on which the request was received.

methods.name: getLocalPort

returns.description: The port number on which the request was received

methods.description: Returns the Internet Protocol (IP) port number of the interface on which the request was received.

methods.name: getServerName

returns.description: The name of the server to which the request was sent

methods.description: Returns the host name of the server to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part before : in the Host header value, if any, or the resolved server name, or the server IP address.

methods.name: getServerPort

returns.description: The port number to which the request was sent

methods.description: Returns the port number to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part after : in the Host header value, if any, or the server port where the client connection was accepted on.

methods.name: getScheme

returns.description: The name of the scheme used to make this request (e.g., http or https)

methods.description: Returns the name of the scheme used to make this request, for example http, https, or ftp.

methods.name: getProtocol

returns.description: The protocol name and version (e.g., HTTP/1.1)

methods.description: Returns the name and version of the protocol the request uses in the form protocol/majorVersion.minorVersion, for example HTTP/1.1.

methods.name: isSecure

returns.description: True if the request was made using a secure channel such as HTTPS

methods.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether this request was made using a secure channel, such as HTTPS.

methods.name: getLocale

returns.description: The preferred Locale for the client

methods.description: Returns the preferred Locale that the client will accept content in, based on the Accept-Language header. If the client request doesn't provide an Accept-Language header, this method returns the default locale for the server.

classes.name: HttpServletResponse
classes.description: Extends the ServletResponse interface to provide HTTP-specific functionality in sending a response. The servlet container creates an HttpServletResponse object and passes it as an argument to the servlet's service methods (doGet, doPost, etc.).

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Sets the status code for this response. This method is used to set the return status code when there is no error. Use sendError to send an error with a description.

methods.name: getStatus

returns.description: The current status code set on this response

methods.description: Gets the current status code of this response.

methods.name: setHeader
methods.description: Sets a response header with the given name and value. If the header had already been set, the new value overwrites the previous one.

methods.name: addHeader
methods.description: Adds a response header with the given name and value. This method allows response headers to have multiple values.

methods.name: setIntHeader
methods.description: Sets a response header with the given name and integer value. If the header had already been set, the new value overwrites the previous one.

methods.name: addIntHeader
methods.description: Adds a response header with the given name and integer value. This method allows response headers to have multiple values.

methods.name: setDateHeader

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the header to set

params.name: date
params.description: The assigned date value in milliseconds since the epoch

methods.description: Sets a response header with the given name and date-value. The date is specified in terms of milliseconds since the epoch.

methods.name: containsHeader

returns.description: True if the named response header has already been set

methods.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether the named response header has already been set.

methods.name: setContentType

params.name: type
params.description: The MIME type of the content (e.g., text/html, application/json)

methods.description: Sets the content type of the response being sent to the client, if the response has not been committed yet. The given content type may include a character encoding specification.

methods.name: getContentType

returns.description: The content type used for the MIME body sent in this response, or null if not defined

methods.description: Returns the content type used for the MIME body sent in this response.

methods.name: setContentLength
methods.description: Sets the length of the content body in the response. In HTTP servlets, this method sets the HTTP Content-Length header.

methods.name: setCharacterEncoding
methods.description: Sets the character encoding (MIME charset) of the response being sent to the client. If the content type has already been set, the charset in the content type string is updated.

methods.name: getCharacterEncoding

returns.description: The character encoding name, e.g., UTF-8

methods.description: Returns the name of the character encoding (MIME charset) used for the body sent in this response.

methods.name: getOutputStream

returns.description: A ServletOutputStream for writing binary data to the response body

methods.description: Returns a ServletOutputStream suitable for writing binary data in the response. Either this method or getWriter may be called to write the body, not both.

methods.name: getWriter

returns.description: A PrintWriter for writing character text to the response body

methods.description: Returns a PrintWriter object that can send character text to the client. The character encoding used is that set by setCharacterEncoding or setContentType.

methods.name: sendError
methods.description: Sends an error response to the client using the specified status code and clears the buffer. The server defaults to creating the response to look like an HTML-formatted server error page.

methods.name: sendError
methods.description: Sends an error response to the client using the specified status code and descriptive message. The server defaults to creating the response to look like an HTML-formatted server error page.

methods.name: sendRedirect
methods.description: Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using the specified redirect location URL and clears the buffer.

methods.name: addCookie

params.name: cookie
params.description: The Cookie to return to the client

methods.description: Adds the specified cookie to the response. This method can be called multiple times to set more than one cookie.

methods.name: encodeURL

returns.description: The encoded URL, or the URL unchanged if encoding is not needed

methods.description: Encodes the specified URL by including the session ID in it, or returns the URL unchanged if encoding is not needed. The implementation of this method includes the logic to determine whether the session ID needs to be encoded in the URL.

methods.name: encodeRedirectURL

returns.description: The encoded URL, or the URL unchanged if encoding is not needed

methods.description: Encodes the specified URL for use in the sendRedirect method or, if encoding is not needed, returns the URL unchanged.

methods.name: flushBuffer
methods.description: Forces any content in the buffer to be written to the client. A call to this method automatically commits the response, meaning the status code and headers will be written.

methods.name: resetBuffer
methods.description: Clears the content of the underlying buffer in the response without clearing headers or status code. Throws IllegalStateException if the response has been committed.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Clears any data that exists in the buffer as well as the status code and headers. Throws IllegalStateException if the response has already been committed.

methods.name: setBufferSize

params.name: size
params.description: The preferred buffer size in bytes

methods.description: Sets the preferred buffer size for the body of the response. The servlet container will use a buffer at least as large as the size requested.

methods.name: getBufferSize

returns.description: The actual buffer size used

methods.description: Returns the actual buffer size used for the response. If no buffering is used, this method returns 0.

methods.name: isCommitted

returns.description: True if the response has been committed

methods.description: Returns a boolean indicating if the response has been committed. A committed response has already had its status code and headers written.

fields.name: SC_OK
fields.description: Status code 200 indicating the request succeeded normally.

fields.name: SC_CREATED
fields.description: Status code 201 indicating the request succeeded and created a new resource on the server.

fields.name: SC_NO_CONTENT
fields.description: Status code 204 indicating the request succeeded but there is no new information to return.

fields.name: SC_MOVED_PERMANENTLY
fields.description: Status code 301 indicating the resource has permanently moved to a new location.

fields.name: SC_FOUND
fields.description: Status code 302 indicating the resource has temporarily moved to another location.

fields.name: SC_NOT_MODIFIED
fields.description: Status code 304 indicating the resource has not been modified since the last request.

fields.name: SC_BAD_REQUEST
fields.description: Status code 400 indicating the request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect.

fields.name: SC_UNAUTHORIZED
fields.description: Status code 401 indicating the request requires HTTP authentication.

fields.name: SC_FORBIDDEN
fields.description: Status code 403 indicating the server understood the request but refused to fulfill it.

fields.name: SC_NOT_FOUND
fields.description: Status code 404 indicating the requested resource is not available.

fields.name: SC_METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED
fields.description: Status code 405 indicating the HTTP method is not allowed for the requested resource.

fields.name: SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
fields.description: Status code 500 indicating an error inside the HTTP server which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

fields.name: SC_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
fields.description: Status code 503 indicating the HTTP server is temporarily overloaded and unable to handle the request.

classes.name: HttpSession
classes.description: Provides a way to identify a user across more than one page request or visit to a Web site and to store information about that user. The servlet container uses this interface to create a session between an HTTP client and an HTTP server.

methods.name: getAttribute

returns.description: The object bound with the specified name, or null if no object is bound under the name

methods.description: Returns the object bound with the specified name in this session, or null if no object is bound under the name.

methods.name: setAttribute

params.name: name
params.description: The name to which the object is bound

methods.description: Binds an object to this session, using the name specified. If an object of the same name is already bound to the session, the object is replaced.

methods.name: removeAttribute

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the attribute to remove

methods.description: Removes the object bound with the specified name from this session. If the session does not have an object bound with the specified name, this method does nothing.

methods.name: getAttributeNames

returns.description: An Enumeration of String objects specifying the names of all objects bound to this session

methods.description: Returns an Enumeration of String objects containing the names of all the objects bound to this session.

methods.name: getId

returns.description: A string specifying the unique identifier assigned to this session

methods.description: Returns a string containing the unique identifier assigned to this session. The identifier is assigned by the servlet container and is implementation dependent.

methods.name: getCreationTime

returns.description: The time when this session was created, measured in milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT

methods.description: Returns the time when this session was created, measured in milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

methods.name: getLastAccessedTime

returns.description: The last time the client sent a request associated with this session, in milliseconds since the epoch

methods.description: Returns the last time the client sent a request associated with this session, as the number of milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT, and marked by the time the container received the request.

methods.name: setMaxInactiveInterval

params.name: interval
params.description: The number of seconds before the session times out. A negative value means the session should never time out.

methods.description: Specifies the time, in seconds, between client requests before the servlet container will invalidate this session. A negative time indicates the session should never time out.

methods.name: getMaxInactiveInterval

returns.description: The maximum time interval, in seconds, that the session will be kept open between client accesses

methods.description: Returns the maximum time interval, in seconds, that the servlet container will keep this session open between client accesses. A negative value means the session never times out.

methods.name: invalidate
methods.description: Invalidates this session then unbinds any objects bound to it. Throws IllegalStateException if called on an already invalidated session.

methods.name: isNew

returns.description: True if the server has created a session but the client has not yet joined

methods.description: Returns true if the client does not yet know about the session or if the client chooses not to join the session.

classes.name: Cookie
classes.description: Creates a cookie, a small amount of information sent by a servlet to a Web browser, saved by the browser, and later sent back to the server. A cookie has a name, a single value, and optional attributes such as a comment, path, domain, maximum age, and version number.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie, which must conform to RFC 2109

constructors.description: Constructs a cookie with the specified name and value. The name must conform to RFC 2109 and cannot contain whitespace or the following characters: [ ] ( ) = , " / ? @ : ;

methods.name: getName

returns.description: The name of the cookie

methods.description: Returns the name of the cookie. The name cannot be changed after creation.

methods.name: getValue

returns.description: The value of the cookie

methods.description: Gets the current value of this cookie.

methods.name: setValue

params.name: newValue
params.description: The new value of the cookie

methods.description: Assigns a new value to this cookie.

methods.name: getDomain

returns.description: The domain name set for this cookie

methods.description: Gets the domain name of this cookie. Domain names are formatted according to RFC 2109.

methods.name: setDomain

params.name: domain
params.description: The domain name within which this cookie is visible

methods.description: Specifies the domain within which this cookie should be presented. The form of the domain name is specified by RFC 2109.

methods.name: getPath

returns.description: The path on the server to which the browser returns this cookie

methods.description: Returns the path on the server to which the browser returns this cookie. The cookie is visible to all subpaths on the server.

methods.name: setPath

params.name: uri
params.description: The URI path for which the cookie is valid

methods.description: Specifies a path for the cookie to which the client should return the cookie. The cookie is visible to all the pages in the directory specified and all subdirectories.

methods.name: getMaxAge

returns.description: The maximum age in seconds. A negative value means the cookie persists until browser shutdown.

methods.description: Gets the maximum age in seconds of this cookie. By default, -1 is returned, which indicates that the cookie will persist until browser shutdown.

methods.name: setMaxAge

params.name: expiry
params.description: The maximum age of the cookie in seconds; 0 deletes the cookie; negative means the cookie is not stored persistently

methods.description: Sets the maximum age in seconds for this cookie. A positive value indicates the cookie will expire after that many seconds. A value of zero causes the cookie to be deleted. A negative value means the cookie is not stored persistently and will be deleted when the Web browser exits.

methods.name: getSecure

returns.description: True if the browser is sending cookies only over a secure protocol, false otherwise

methods.description: Returns true if the browser is sending cookies only over a secure protocol, or false if the browser can send cookies using any protocol.

methods.name: setSecure

params.name: flag
params.description: True if the cookie should only be sent using a secure protocol

methods.description: Indicates to the browser whether the cookie should only be sent using a secure protocol, such as HTTPS or SSL.

methods.name: isHttpOnly

returns.description: True if the cookie is HTTP only, preventing client-side script access

methods.description: Checks whether this cookie has been marked as HttpOnly. HttpOnly cookies are not supposed to be exposed to client-side scripting code.

methods.name: setHttpOnly

params.name: isHttpOnly
params.description: True to mark the cookie as HTTP only

methods.description: Marks or unmarks this cookie as HttpOnly. If isHttpOnly is set to true, the cookie is not accessible to client-side scripting code.

methods.name: getComment

returns.description: The comment of the cookie, or null if the cookie has no comment

methods.description: Returns the comment describing the purpose of this cookie, or null if the cookie has no comment.

methods.name: setComment

params.name: purpose
params.description: The comment to display to the user

methods.description: Specifies a comment that describes a cookie's purpose. The comment is useful if the browser presents the cookie to the user.

methods.name: getVersion

returns.description: 0 if the cookie complies with the original Netscape spec; 1 if the cookie complies with RFC 2109

methods.description: Returns the version of the protocol this cookie complies with. Version 0 complies with the original Netscape cookie specification. Version 1 complies with RFC 2109.

methods.name: setVersion

params.name: v
params.description: 0 for the Netscape cookie spec; 1 for RFC 2109

methods.description: Sets the version of the cookie protocol that this cookie complies with. Version 0 is the original Netscape cookie specification. Version 1 complies with RFC 2109.

methods.name: clone

returns.description: A clone of this cookie

methods.description: Overrides the standard java.lang.Object.clone method to return a copy of this cookie.
